item.title: {PI} Adding Ints (Model)
item.dc:creator: @RegalX RegalX
item.description:
@RegalX wrote:

Tutorial:

You add them in the ItemDef class. What is weird about it? Also, the class8 one is the one Deltascape uses.

^ this. Class8 is the delta ints. ItemDef.java is where you add the ints for project insanity.

item.title: {PI} Adding Ints (Model)
item.dc:creator: @Just_Lurkin Just Lurkin
item.description:
@Just_Lurkin wrote:

Hey in PI where do you add model ints? I don’t have itemdef2.java and just itemdef.java was weird for a model int… I’ll show you.
Itemdef2:

case 13370: itemDef.modelid = 62697; itemDef.name = "Ancient ceremonial gloves"; itemDef.modelZoom = 548; itemDef.modelRotationY = 618; itemDef.modelRotationX = 1143; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -5; itemDef.anInt165 = 62735; itemDef.anInt200 = 62752; itemDef.groundActions = new String[5]; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop"; break;]
Normal Model Int:

if(i == 9014) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[3]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[3]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 960; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 22464; class8.anIntArray156[2] = 43968; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 107; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 107; class8.anIntArray160[2] = 107; class8.anInt174 = 1015; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.anInt181 = 720; class8.anInt190 = 0; class8.anInt198 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.anInt165 = 1017; class8.anInt200 = 1017; class8.aString170 = "Item Name"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Item desc".getBytes(); }

Read full topic
